form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Flake (for himself and Mr. Manchin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To ensure that individuals do not simultaneously receive unemployment compensation and disability insurance benefits.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reducing Overlapping Payments Act.

section.header: Prohibition on payment of benefits based on receipt of unemployment compensation

subsection.text: Title II of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 401 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 224 the following new section:

section.header: Prohibition on payment of benefits based on receipt of unemployment compensation

subsection.text: If for any month prior to the month in which an individual attains retirement age (as defined in section 216(l)(1))â€”

paragraph.text: such individual is entitled to benefits under section 223, and
such individual is entitled for such month to unemployment compensation,

section.continuation-text: the total of the individual's benefits under section 223 for such month and of any benefits under subsections (b) through (h) of section 202 for such month based on the individual's wages and self-employment income shall be reduced to zero.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the head of any Federal agency shall provide such information within its possession as the Commissioner may require for purposes of making a timely determination under this section for reduction of benefits payable under this title, or verifying other information necessary in carrying out the provisions of this section.

The Commissioner is authorized to enter into agreements with States, political subdivisions, and other organizations that administer unemployment compensation, in order to obtain such information as the Commissioner may require to carry out the provisions of this section.

Any determination by the Commissioner pursuant to this section shall be subject to the requirements described in section 205(b)(1), including provision of reasonable notice and opportunity for a hearing.

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term unemployment compensation has the meaning given that term in section 85(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to benefits payable for months beginning after 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
